result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley N Pugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.  

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with any other court orders.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Concurrent with: Trempealeau County Case now serving.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defense stipulated to revoking the DPA.
Motion hearing on August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley N Pugh

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant did not receive the motion.  Copy given to the defendant in court.  She contacted SPD and qualified.  Reschedule motion 8/15 at 3 pm
to Revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Defendant appears without counsel and has previously waived counsel.  Gerald Fox appears for the State and presents a DPA to the Court.  Defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney today.  Judge reviews the charge and possible penalties.  Plea to Count 1 - no contest.  Court reviews plea questionnaire/waiver of rights/diversion agreement with defendant.  Court finds the defendant understands the proceedings and plea is made freely and voluntarily made and she waives her rights.  Factual basis exists in the complaint.  Court approves the diversion agreement and will hold the case open for up to 12 months.

Court reviewed the form with the defendant.  She understood the form and the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to counsel.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  She understood.  Attorney options explained to the defendant.  Defendant does not want an attorney. Defendant to fill out right to attorney and waiver form.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court asked the defendant why she didn't appear for initial appearance.  She said she was working the 3rd shift.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties in the complaint.  Defendant understood.  Bond reinstated.  AIA set for 1/4/16.  Court advised the defendant to contact the SPD.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-04-2016 09:30 am

Ashley called at 3:50 p.m. said she just got up; wanted to know what happened in court this morning; explained warrant was authorized for her FTA; she works 3rd shift; explained she should try calling the PD office to see if she qualifies; she can come at 1p.m. for bond hearings everyday; told her to please stop at the Clerk of Courts office 1st so we can let court and DA know she is here
